descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will introduce non-music majors to various aspects of the Western musical tradition. Paying special attention to classical music, the course aims to give students the fundamental necessary tools to approach musical phenomena: What are the elements of music? How can we get the most out of a listening experience? Class discussion will take into consideration the specific historical, social, and aesthetic contexts surrounding each of several musical case studies. Students are expected to prepare reading and listening assignments for each session, to share their thoughts with the rest of the class in discussion, and to attend a variety of concerts.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Course textbook: Thomas Forrest Kelly, Music Then and Now. New York: W.W. Norton & Company, 2012. ISBN 9780393929881
